title: How to Use VLC Media Player to Listen to Internet Radio

steps.title: Click the Media menu in VLC Media Player.
steps.content: Click the Media menu in VLC Media Player. If you have the URL of an internet radio station you would like to stream in VLC Media Player, use this method to listen to the stream. You'll see this menu in the top right corner of the VLC window. Many internet radio stations give you the URL to stream their station. If you don't know what you want to listen to yet, you can check out one of these options, or jump down to Browsing Radio Stations . BBC World Service - https://stream.live.vc.bbcmedia.co.uk/bbc_world_service NPR News - https://npr-ice.streamguys1.com/live.mp3 Classic FM - http://media-ice.musicradio.com/ClassicFM

steps.title: Select Open Network Stream.
steps.content: Select Open Network Stream . Alternatively, press Ctrl + N .

steps.title: Enter the URL of the station in the address bar.
steps.content: Enter the URL of the station in the address bar. If you have copied the URL to your clipboard, just press Ctrl + V to paste it.

steps.title: Click the Play button.
steps.content: Click the Play button. It's in the window's lower right corner. This will start playing the internet radio URL you entered. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the File menu in VLC Media Player.
steps.content: Click the File menu in VLC Media Player. This menu is in the menu bar at the top of your screen when VLC Media Player is open. You can use this method to stream an internet radio station you already have the URL for. Many internet radio stations give you the URL to stream their stations. If you don't know what you want to listen to yet, you can check out one of these options, or jump down to Browsing Radio Stations . BBC World Service - https://stream.live.vc.bbcmedia.co.uk/bbc_world_service NPR News - https://npr-ice.streamguys1.com/live.mp3 Classic FM - http://media-ice.musicradio.com/ClassicFM

steps.title: Select Open Network.
steps.content: Select Open Network . Alternatively, press Cmd + N .

steps.title: Enter the URL of the station in the address bar.
steps.content: Enter the URL of the station in the address bar. If it's copied to your clipboard, just press Cmd + V to paste it.

steps.title: Click the Play button.
steps.content: Click the Play button. It's in the lower right corner of the window. This will start streaming the internet radio station from the URL you entered. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the View menu and select Playlist (Windows only).
steps.content: Click the View menu and select Playlist (Windows only). This toggles on Playlist view, where you can find a list of internet radio stations you can listen to in VLC Media Player. Alternatively, you can use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl + L (Windows) or Cmd + L (Mac) to get there. Skip this step if you're using a Mac since the playlist view opens automatically when you open the desktop app. If you don't see playlists in the left panel, press Cmd + L to display them.

steps.title: Click Icecast Radio Directory.
steps.content: Click Icecast Radio Directory . It's under the "Internet" header in the menu on the left side of the window. Icecast is a streaming media service that hosts hundreds of internet radio stations. You can search the Icecast list in VLC for specific stations (including many on-air radio stations from various regions), or just browse to see what's out there. You can also check out Jamendo Selections under "Internet" in the left panel for other streaming music to listen to. Jamendo offers trending tracks in various genres.

steps.title: Double-click a station to listen.
steps.content: Double-click a station to listen. In the playlist on the right side of the window, double-click a station to listen to it. Use the player controls at the bottom of the VLC window to manage playback, like pausing or stopping the music. [3] X Research source

steps.title: How can I save a radio station so I don't have to keep entering the URL?
steps.content: How can I save a radio station so I don't have to keep entering the URL? You can add an internet radio station to your favorites in VLC by right-clicking (or control-clicking) the station when it's playing, then selecting Save Playlist to File . The next time you want to listen to that radio station, just double-click that file. Alternatively, go to Media > Open File or File > Open File and select your station's file to start listening.

steps.title: Why is VLC Media Player buffering all the time?
steps.content: Why is VLC Media Player buffering all the time? If VLC keeps buffering when you're trying to stream internet radio, there could be a problem with your internet connection . Try disconnecting and reconnecting from the internet or connecting to a different network.

steps.title: Why can't I listen to internet radio in VLC Media Player?
steps.content: Why can't I listen to internet radio in VLC Media Player? If the radio station URL you enter isn't working in VLC, you may have copied the wrong URL, or the station isn't in a format that VLC supports. Not every station plays in VLC. There can also be codec issues. In that case, make sure your version of VLC is updated.

steps.title: Can I listen to internet radio without VLC?
steps.content: Can I listen to internet radio without VLC? Yes! Many radio stations have sites online that you can visit to listen on your computer, phone, or tablet. Just go directly to the station's website to see if they have an online player.

steps.title: What is Icecast in VLC Media Player?
steps.content: What is Icecast in VLC Media Player? Icecast is a free streaming media server platform that can be used to create a streaming internet radio station, podcast, privately running jukebox, and more. Icecast, in VLC Media Player, is a directory of radio stations using the Icecast platform. [4] X Research source
